definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
to fall head over heels in love/to be passionately in love
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to squeeze in/to step in/to take part/to step between (two persons in a relationship)
derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
